page.title: 05DUFTON CHURCH
page.content: The sandstone church of St.Cuthbert is situated just off a narrow winding road mid-way between the villages of Dufton and Knock.It has a rural setting near the banks of the Swindale Beck with views to the nearby fells. The surrounding churchyard is bounded by farmland and is approached by a rough track across pastureland. Dufton's annual agricultural show is held here. The site is ancient,but the present building is dated 1780.The registers go back to the 16th century and there is a possible Saxon figure on a wall panel in the Chancery. Dufton shares a vicar with the neighbouring 2 parishes,but there is an active congregation and a weekly service.All 3 parishes are joining together at present to produce a revue in the church in November.
